p: Oxalates are a common constituent of plants. Studies have shown that oxalate can perform different roles in plants, including calcium regulation, ion balance, plant protection, tissue support, and heavy metal detoxification (Idu et al., 2016; Rahman & Kawamura, 2011). Oxalates provide essential nutrients, fiber, antioxidants, and other important phytochemicals. Figures 3 and 4 show that the phytic and oxalic acid contents of D. dewevrei are slightly more in the leaves than in the fruits. However, both phytic and oxalic acid contents of D. dewerei are together less than those found present in LPC, cooked and sun‚Äêdried Cnidoscolusa conitifolius (Aye, 2012), and the FAO permissible daily required intake.
